content: Princess knocked her two brothers out of the ball park with an instant bullseyeRead More:  'I could use him in the garden!' Royal fans go wild as Prince Louis gets stuck into some shovelling during surprise appearance at Big Help OutPrincess Charlotte showed off her archery skills as she made a surprise appearance at the Big Help Out initiative in Slough this morning.

The eight-year-old delighted volunteers as she arrived at a local Scouts headquarters along with William, 40, Kate, 41, as well as brothers George, nine, and  Louis, five.Following on from the Coronation concert last night, the family spent hours renovating some Scouts huts for local members to use.After this, the family-of-five happily participated in some of the activities on offer with Scouts - including finger-painting, toasting marshmallows and operating a digger.While exploring the headquarters, Princess Charlotte also gave archery a go - and looked perfectly at ease with the plastic bow and arrow.

Dressed in a £299 Ralph Lauren pink cable knit jumper, jean shorts and £20 trainers, Charlotte wore a yellow-and-purple Scouts tie around her neck.Kate and William's second child looked like a pro as she operated the bow and eyed up her target ahead of time.Charlotte appeared to channel all her strength into the task at hand and frowned slightly as she let go of the bow. Having clearly inherited her mother's sporting talents, Charlotte managed to get an instant bullseye on her first try - blowing her brothers out of the park. After shovelling sand and getting behind the wheel of a JCB, Prince Louis attempted to shoot the bow and arrow.Determined not to accept any help, Prince Louis ran back and forth several times to pick up his arrows and hit the target on multiple occasions.
The adorable five-year-old grimaced as he studied the target in front of him - trying his best to keep up with his older siblings.‘Come on, Louis, you can do it,’ Kate called.

When it was Prince George's turn, he decided to go up against his parents.But as he tried it out, Prince William provided his son with some tips as he watched over his shoulder. Finally, the Princess of Wales tried her hand at the activity too. Although the Princess did have the slight advantage of having taken an archery lesson during a 2016 royal visit to Bhutan. While the Princess of Wales was all smiles as she listened to her instructor, Prince William appeared to take the task incredibly seriously and looked incredibly focus as he drew his bow.What's more, Kate was seen pushing a wheelbarrow while her youngest son shoveled in sand as they helped spruce up a Slough scout hut.

He then took control, steering it expertly as his mum supported its weight.Charlotte was seen delightedly running to help prepare a new path while George, a future king himself, was spotted learning how to use a power drill. The couple and their three children were out and about again to mark the third day of the King’s Coronation, and Charles III's life of service.

The Princess of Wales has been Joint President of the Scouts since 2020 and the royals joined volunteers resetting a path, digging a new soakaway, sanding and revarnishing the front door, adding planters to the front of the building and adding a mural to create a lasting legacy of the Big Help Out’s work.

William and Kate attended in support of the Big Help Out along with other senior royals including the Duke and Duchess of Edinburgh, the Princess Royal and the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester.The Big Help Out scheme, which aims to inspire a new generation of volunteers by giving people a taster of what they can achieve, has been backed by celebrities across the country. The scheme, which aims to inspire a new generation of volunteers by giving people a taster of what they can achieve, has been backed by celebrities across the country. More than 1,500 charities have signed up. The Big Help Out has been organised by The Together Coalition and leading charities.
